medium: Black chalk, gray wash, and graphite, squared in red and black chalk, with brown ink framing lines
title: Bouquet of Flowers in a Terracotta Vase
marks: Signature and Date at left on ledge, in black: [Jan V huysum / fec. 1
text: Jan van Huysum was one of the greatest flower painters of all time. He always painted directly from actual flowers, but through drawings such as this, he created in his imagination arrangements of flowers that bloomed at various times of year. This drawing has been squared to help him copy it-probably to a canvas on which he then painted.
description: large bouquet of flowers in a vase decorated with putti in relief, sitting on a ledge; other flowers on top of ledge; drawn with grid with red chalk and pencil
creditline: The Martin and Brown Endowment Fund and the Marguerite S. McNally Endowment for Art Acquisition
